result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven B Quigley in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew H. Huppertz.    Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 13CF875 and 14CF358, Court grants the State's motion.
From Dodge Correctional Institution for July 18, 2014 Plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Matthew H. Huppertz in court.   Defendant Steven B Quigley did not appear.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called at 9:13 am.  Defendant was not on transport list.  Court orders OTP for 7-15-14.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Steven B Quigley in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Bricco for attorney Joan B. Broughton.   Erik J. Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.

Defendant Steven B Quigley in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Debra L. Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Cash bail set at $2500
